Description: Postcard; printed paper; black and white photograph showing pylon and obelisk in the Temple of Luxor.
Curator's comments: Old card; postally unused but message written on the back as part of a series. This part is numbered "4" and reads: "... out here & I am always longing to know what you think about things interesting to me. Don't think I am cross, pet. I am not but I am terribly lovesick, you know & just one word about above will be very welcomed. You don't mind me mentioning it, do you? Holland left here by the 9.10 train this morning for Port Said - lucky boy. Mr Jessop is coming out probably on Saturday so perhaps I shall hear something which will be welcomed if it is some kind of alteration or a move. By the way, dear, has my article the Vicar asked me to write for St John's magazine appeared yet? I should very much like a copy if it has. Do they still have that Intercession service on Friday afternoons? And do..." The first card in this sequence is EPH-ME 2995. Judging by the date, sender's address and handwriting it is from someone called Jack to Miss Florence Bradbury, who is usually addressed as Florrie.
